summary:
Global public health professional with experience in health policy, research, evaluation and project management. Diplomatic communicator and strategic thinker with proven capacity to advance complex strategic and operational projects across institutions. Results-driven, collaborative and adaptive leader with demonstrated ability to build strong stakeholder relationships and partnerships, and manage projects from conceptualization through implementation and evaluation. Strong, adaptive team player that thrives under pressure and in fast-paced environments.

Passionate about improving the quality of, and equitable access to, health care for patients internationally, with a particular focus on mental health. Strong interest in strategies that leverage the power of technology and innovation as a means of responding to complex, multisectoral issues affecting vulnerable populations. Experience in a wide range of health issues, across government, academic, not-for-profit and multilateral sectors.

Native French and English speaker with basic proficiency in Spanish and German.

'description': 'El objetivo de eSAC es contribuir a la mejora de la salud y el bienestar de los grupos marginados de la población de la región, para avanzar hacia la equidad en salud a través del desarrollo y aplicación de soluciones en tecnologías de la información y las comunicaciones (TIC) basadas en la salud pública.\n\neSAC busca estimular los investigadores, a los tomadores de decisiones, profesionales, empresarios, innovadores, a los medios de comunicación y al público en general “a pensar más allá” de las soluciones tradicionales de salud en línea, con un enfoque a nivel individual, mediante la exploración del uso de las TIC en la salud pública con el ánimo de influir en los determinantes sociales de la salud.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', •	Developed and executed strategies, partnerships and client engagement work plans in the areas of public health policy and political advocacy, strategic positioning and communication, ally and narrative building, and issues management. 
•	Supported business development including leading pitches, cultivating new business opportunities, negotiating contracts, brand building and new service offerings.', 'title': 'Director', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': 5350, 'name': 'World Health Organization', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQEhC1u0R5DRQQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1663777944960?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=j5hFxDNxJXWTH17YwPs98UUMHEDU2aNYw37szFDW218', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/world-health-organization/', 'employees': {'start': 5001, 'end': 10000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Geneva, Switzerland', 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'company': 'World Health Organization', 'description': "•	Provided technical support to countries, especially low- and middle-income countries, in strengthening policy, service planning and delivery, and health information system strengthening for dementia. This includes organizing and facilitating workshops at country and regional levels.

•	Managed the implementation of WHO’s Global Dementia Observatory, a data and knowledge exchange platform aimed at strengthening countries’ policies, service planning and health and social care systems for dementia.
